structure.unit: GENERAL PROVISIONS CONCERNING CRIMES AND PUNISHMENTS

text.section: A person who accepts a report of criminal activity on behalf of a crime stoppers organization shall be guilty of unlawful disclosure of information if the person intentionally or knowingly divulges to a person not employed by a law enforcement agency the identity of the person who made the report without the consent of the person who made the report.
Unlawful disclosure of information under this section shall be a Class A misdemeanor.

law.history: Created 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 59, sec. 4, effective July 14, 1992.
